etymologies: Middle English: via Old French from Latin singulus, related to simplus ‘simple’

definitions: only one; not one of several

examples.text: the kingdom was ruled over by a single family

short_definitions: only one

definitions: regarded as distinct from each other or others in a group

examples.text: alcohol is the single most important cause of violence
she wrote down every single word

short_definitions: regarded as distinct from each other or others in group

definitions: even one (used for emphasis)

examples.text: they didn't receive a single reply

short_definitions: even one

definitions: designed or suitable for one person
short_definitions: designed or suitable for one person

definitions: not accompanied by others; alone.
short_definitions: not accompanied by others

definitions: unmarried or not involved in a stable sexual relationship
short_definitions: unmarried or not involved in stable sexual relationship

definitions: consisting of one part

examples.text: the studio was a single large room

short_definitions: consisting of one part

definitions: (of a ticket) valid for an outward journey only, not for the return
short_definitions: valid for outward journey only, not for return

definitions: (of a flower) having only one whorl of petals

examples.text: the individual blooms can be single, semi-double, or fully double

short_definitions: (of flower) having only one whorl of petals

definitions: denoting an alcoholic drink that consists of one measure of spirits
short_definitions: denoting alcoholic drink that consists of one measure of spirits

definitions: free from duplicity or deceit; ingenuous
short_definitions: free from duplicity or deceit

definitions: an individual person or thing rather than part of a pair or a group.
short_definitions: individual person or thing rather than part of pair

definitions: a short record or CD featuring one main song or track.
short_definitions: short record or CD featuring one main song or track

definitions: people who are unmarried or not involved in a stable sexual relationship

examples.text: the divorce rate is rising so you'll see more singles in their late 30s and early 40s

short_definitions: people who are unmarried or not involved in stable sexual relationship

definitions: a ticket that is valid only for an outward journey.
short_definitions: ticket that is valid only for outward journey

definitions: a bedroom, especially in a hotel, that is suitable for one person.
short_definitions: bedroom that is suitable for one person

definitions: a single measure of spirits.
short_definitions: single measure of spirits

definitions: a one-dollar note.
short_definitions: one-dollar note

definitions: a hit for one run.
short_definitions: hit for one run

definitions: a hit which allows the batter to proceed safely to first base.
short_definitions: hit which allows batter to proceed safely to first base

definitions: (especially in tennis and badminton) a game or competition for individual players, not pairs or teams.
short_definitions: game for individual players

definitions: a system of change-ringing in which one pair of bells changes places at each round.
short_definitions: system of change-ringing in which one pair of bells changes places at each round

definitions: choose someone or something from a group for special treatment

examples.text: one newspaper was singled out for criticism

short_definitions: choose person or thing from group for special treatment

definitions: thin out (seedlings or saplings)

examples.text: hand hoes are used for singling roots

short_definitions: thin out

definitions: reduce (a railway track) to a single line

examples.text: the South Western line was singled west of Salisbury

short_definitions: reduce railway track to single line

definitions: hit a single
short_definitions: hit single

definitions: cause (a run) to be scored by hitting a single.
short_definitions: cause run to be scored by hitting single

definitions: advance (a runner) by hitting a single.
short_definitions: advance runner by hitting single
